content.description: Sit start with left on a finger lock and right on a crimp. Go up  and make way up the boulder by finding interesting side pulls and other features. Trend left to find a friendly top out
content.location: This is the most left line on the boulder. There is a slab with spray painted number 5 on it to the left of it

content.description: Same start as Doctor will see you. Instead of going straight up go right following the rail go to the arete then use the arete to top out.
Start on slopper rail and go straight up using side pulls and interesting features. Very easy top out.
content.location: This is the center line next to a tree.

content.description: Sit start with some pinches and work your way up to the right side of the crack. Traverse the overhang and hook your right foot on the ledge. There's a lot of options, but none of them are good except a left side pull and you have to hit the bottom of it - or if you're feeling like Peter Pan and believe you can fly - you can go to the second star on the right and straight on 'til morning with the ledge. The top out makes you think, take it slow. The branch off line in this picture is just to show where your body will end up sideways.
content.location: This is to the right of the Campfire Roof problem, which is on the SW side of the boulder you park next to for Area 5 at Darnell.

content.description:
Sit start on horizontal features and move up to flat jugs where the roof meets the short face. Find a heel toe cam and hope you have a +8 ape index as you reach for a jug over the lip. Realistically, use crimps to bump into the jug and topout up the face on easier features.

Don't actually have a campfire under the roof because it damages the rock.
content.location: This line starts on the south west side of the boulder you park next to for area 5 at Darnell. It is the left line in the picture.
